languageTools.program.agent

Class Module

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.parser.ParsedObject
      • languageTools.program.agent.Module
  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    public class Module
extends ParsedObject

    Author:
    N.Kraayenbrink, K.Hindriks, W.Pasman made Module serializable for Q learning #2246.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Module.ExitCondition
      The various exit conditions of a Module: NOGOALS, NOACTION, ALWAYS, and NEVER.
      static class  Module.FocusMethod
      Different methods for creating an attention set associated with a module that is called at runtime.
      static class  Module.TYPE
      Types for distinguishing built-in modules from user-defined modules.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Module

        public Module(java.lang.String name,
      java.util.List<Term> parameters,
      Module.TYPE type,
      InputStreamPosition source,
      KRlanguage language)
        Creates a new instance of an (empty) module. Assumes that RuleSet , including options associated with the program section in this module, is added later.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the Module. Should be unique but this is checked in Validators. For an anonymous module, the name is defined by appending _subX to the name of its parent module, where X is the index of the new anonymous module in the set of anonymous child modules of the parent module.
        parameters - The parameters of the module. May be empty, which indicates that no parameters are associated with the module. For anonymous modules, the parameters are derived by the parser from the variables present in the parent rule.
        type - DOC
        source - The location of the start of the definition of the new Module in the program text. May be null if the module is not created by a parser.
        language - the KRLanguage that will be stored in this module. We need it to create empty substitutions when running the module.

        public void addViewDefinition(java.lang.String signature)
        Adds a signature, i.e. string of the form "predicate/arity" to this Module's viewDefinition.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • setRuleSet

        public void setRuleSet(RuleSet ruleSet)
        Sets the RuleSet of this Module.
        Parameters:
        ruleSet - The RuleSet defining this Module's program section. Should not be null.

      • setOptions

        public java.util.List<ValidatorError> setOptions(BracketedOptions options)
        Sets the options for this module.
        There are two available options:
        • focus, which can have any value from the Module.FocusMethod enumeration.
        • exit, which can have any value from the Module.ExitCondition enumeration.
        A warning is generated for every unused option, but are otherwise ignored.
        Parameters:
        options - A parsed list of options.
        Returns:
        A list of possible errors whilst setting the errors (empty when nothing went wrong).

      • isUsed

        public boolean isUsed()
        Returns:
        false if there is absolutely no way the agent can focus on this module. This may not be true the other way around, as it is only checked by checking if there is any focus action that targets this module, or if this is the main or event module.

      • markUsed

        public void markUsed()
        Marks this module as used.

      • isAnonymous

        public boolean isAnonymous()
        Returns whether this Module is an anonymous module.
        Returns:
        true iff this module is anonymous. If true, GOALProgram.getModule() should never return this Module.

      • executeFully

        public Result executeFully(RunState<?> runState,
                  Substitution substitution)

      • execute

        public java.util.concurrent.Callable<java.util.concurrent.Callable<?>> execute(RunState<?> runState,
                                                                      Substitution substitution)
        Executes one step of the Module, and returns a Runnable for executing the next.
        Parameters:
        runState - The current run state of the agent.
        substitution - The substitution that has been passed on to this module when it was called, already with the variables renamed according to the focus call so that the module can use it without renaming.
        Returns:
        Runnable for continuing to execute this module. Null when we should stop.
